game.desc: A port of the popular puzzle game 2048 to libretro.

game.name: Another Metroid 2 Remake
game.desc: AM2R is a fan made remake of Metroid 2, with new gameplay, updated 16 bit style graphics, and an original soundtrack.

game.name: Blues Brothers
game.desc: The Blues Brothers are on the run from the law. Take control of either bulky Jake or nippy Elwood in this five-level platform game. You must cross a prison, a river and the big city to reach freedom.

game.name: Blues Brothers Jukebox Adventure
game.desc: The Blues Brothers: Jukebox Adventure is a video game based on the band The Blues Brothers, and a sequel to The Blues Brothers.

game.name: Bermuda Syndrome
game.desc: Bermuda Syndrome is a PC game developed by Century Interactive and published by BMG Interactive in 1995.

game.name: Cannonball
game.desc: A port of the Cannonball enhanced OutRun engine to libretro.

game.name: Cave Story
game.desc: An open-source reimplementation of the Cave Story / Doukutsu engine, ported to libretro.

game.name: Cave Story-evo
game.desc: An upgraded open-source reimplementation of the Cave Story / Doukutsu engine.

game.name: C-Dogs
game.desc: C-Dogs SDL is a classic overhead run-and-gun game, supporting up to 4 players in co-op and deathmatch modes.

game.name: Commander Genius
game.desc: Commander Genius is a software piece that interprets the Commander Keen Invasion of the Vorticons and Galaxy series.

game.name: Devilutionx
game.desc: DevilutionX is a source port of Diablo and Hellfire that strives to make it simple to run the game while providing engine improvements, bugfixes, and some optional quality of life features.

game.name: Dinothawr
game.desc: A clever and cute push-the-block-in-a-straight-line puzzle game in the spirit of Kickle Cubicle written from the ground up for libretro.

game.name: Doom
game.desc: Doom is a 1993 first-person shooter game developed by id Software for MS-DOS.

game.name: Doom 2
game.desc: Doom II is a first-person shooter game by id Software.

game.name: Duke Nukem 3D
game.desc: Duke Nukem 3D is a first-person shooter video game developed by 3D Realms. It is a sequel to the platform games Duke Nukem and Duke Nukem II, published by 3D Realms.

game.name: Freedom Planet
game.desc: Freedom Planet is a combat-based platform adventure that pits a spunky dragon girl and her friends against an alien attack force.

game.name: Half-Life
game.desc: Half-Life, a First Person Shooter released by Valve & Sierra in 1998, tells the story of a recently graduated theoretical physicist, named Dr. Gordon Freeman, who is working on experiments in relation to teleportation technology with other scientists in the Black Mesa Research Facility.

game.name: Heart of Darkness
game.desc: HODE is a reimplementation of the engine used by the game 'Heart of Darkness' developed by Amazing Studio.

game.name: Hydra Castle Labyrinth
game.desc: Hydra Castle Labyrinth, originally Meikyuujou Hydra, is a freeware Indie platformer developed by E. Hashimoto.

game.name: Maldita Castilla
game.desc: Maldita Castilla is an action platformer full of actual myths from Spain and some regions of the medieval Europe.

game.name: Moonlight - Game Streaming
game.desc: Moonlight is an open source implementation of NVIDIA's GameStream protocol.

game.name: Mr. Boom
game.desc: A fun, multiplayer and feature-filled clone of the classic Bomberman series, converted from DOS using asm2c. It includes an advanced CPU AI for single-player sessions.

game.name: NAM
game.desc: NAM, sold under the name Napalm in Walmart retail outlets, is a commercial Build engine first-person shooter video game set during the Vietnam War, developed by TNT Team and published by GT Interactive Software.

game.name: nKaruga
game.desc: nKaruga is a IKaruga demake by matref.

game.name: OpenJazz
game.desc: OpenJazz is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games.

game.name: OpenTyrian
game.desc: OpenTyrian is an open-source port of the DOS game Tyrian.

game.name: Prehistorik 2
game.desc: Prehistorik 2 is a platform game, the sequel to Prehistorik. It was developed by Titus Interactive for MS-DOS and Amstrad CPC in 1993.

game.name: Quake
game.desc: Quake is a first-person shooter video game developed by id Software and published by GT Interactive in 1996.

game.name: Quake 2
game.desc: Quake II is a first-person shooter video game released in December 1997. It was developed by id Software and published by Activision.

game.name: RAWGL - Another World
game.desc: RAWGL is a re-implementation of the engine used in the game Another World.

game.name: Redneck Rampage
game.desc: Redneck Rampage is a 1997 first-person shooter game developed by Xatrix Entertainment and published by Interplay.

game.name: Redneck Rampage Rides Again
game.desc: Redneck Rampage Rides Again is the sequel to Redneck Rampage, and includes 14 new single player levels, 7 new multiplayer levels, new enemies, weapons, and vehicles, including motorcycles and swamp boats.

game.name: REminiscence - Flashback
game.desc: REminiscence is a re-implementation of the engine used in the game Flashback made by Delphine Software and released in 1992.

game.name: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
game.desc: Return to Castle Wolfenstein is a first-person shooter video game published by Activision, released on November 19, 2001.

game.name: Rick Dangerous
game.desc: Rick Dangerous is a platform game developed by Core Design.

game.name: Rocks n Diamonds
game.desc: Rocks'n'Diamonds is a scrolling tile-based computer puzzle game that can be described as a combined Boulder Dash, Supaplex, Emerald Mine, Solomon's Key, and Sokoban clone.

game.name: SDL Prince of Persia
game.desc: SDLPoP is an open-source port of Prince of Persia, based on the disassembly of the DOS version, extended with new features.

game.name: Shovel Knight
game.desc: Shovel Knight is a 2D side-scrolling platform game developed and published by Yacht Club Games.

game.name: Sonic 1
game.desc: Sonic the Hedgehog is a platform game developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega for the Sega Genesis home video game console.

game.name: Sonic 2
game.desc: Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is a 1992 platform game developed by Sega Technical Institute (STI) for the Sega Genesis.

game.name: Sonic CD
game.desc: Sonic the Hedgehog CD is a 1993 platform game for the Sega CD developed and published by Sega.

game.name: Spelunky
game.desc: Spelunky is a cave exploration / treasure-hunting game inspired by classic platform games and roguelikes, where the goal is to grab as much treasure from the cave as possible.

game.name: Super Mario 64
game.desc: Super Mario 64 decompilation.

game.name: Streets of Rage Remake
game.desc: Streets of Rage Remake is a remastered version of the MegaDrive classic. You'll go throughout an immense town fighting against people who try to attack you. There are more than 60 different enemies, you can choose among 16 characters, choose your favourite one and kick asses out there.

game.name: Super Mario War
game.desc: Super Mario War is an open-source, cross-platform, platform-adventure video game and level editor released on 16 December 2006.

game.name: SuperTux
game.desc: SuperTux is a open-source classic 2D jump'n run sidescroller game in a style similar to the original Super Mario games.

game.name: Tomb Raider 1
game.desc: Tomb Raider is a 1996 action-adventure video game developed by Core Design and published by Eidos Interactive. OpenLara is used in this port.

game.name: Tomb Raider 2
game.desc: Tomb Raider II is an action-adventure platform game developed by Core Design and published by Eidos Interactive. OpenLara is used in this port. Uncompletable

game.name: Tomb Raider 3
game.desc: Tomb Raider III: Adventures of Lara Croft is an action-adventure video game developed by Core Design and published by Eidos Interactive. OpenLara is used in this port. Uncompletable

game.name: Undertale
game.desc: Undertale is a 2D role-playing video game created by indie developer Toby Fox.

game.name: VVVVVV
game.desc: VVVVVV is a platform game all about exploring one simple mechanical idea - what if you reversed gravity instead of jumping?

game.name: Wolfenstein 3D
game.desc: Wolfenstein 3D is a first-person shooter video game developed by id Software and published by Apogee Software and FormGen.

game.name: World War II GI
game.desc: World War II GI is a first-person shooter video game set during the events of World War II. Developed by TNT Team and published by GT Interactive, the game was released in 1999 as the direct sequel to NAM, which was released the year prior.
